website_summaries.verdict: Versatile tool that can be used for a variety of projects.
pros: Can safely cut concrete, stone, brick, paving, and reinforced concrete
Ergonomic handles make it easy to use and carry

customer_reviews.title: Water added
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rather than sinking more time into repairing my gas saw, a 14" Stihl TS760. *** Water *** The Evolution blade housing is punched for a water kit, so I borrow the one from the TS760. Had to shorten the hollow bolts in order to pass thru the narrower housing. *** Amps *** Will too often trip 15A. Waste of time. Migrated to 20A, but trips were not uncommon even at that level. *** Performance *** 40 feet of 4" slab. Took about two hours. No faults other than the breaker trips. Much lighter than my gas saw.
customer_reviews.author: TRyit

customer_reviews.title: Let it cool down.
customer_reviews.text: For the price point this saw is solid. It's not a professional level saw but more than enough for the home owner. I am using it to cut my basement floor that is 4 inches thick. The saw does need a break every now and then to cool down. It does trip the 20 amp breaker when its getting close to over heating. Let it rest a few minutes when it gets warm and you wont have the breaker issue. If you want a saw that doesn't need the cool down break then spend the 900$ for a Makita. If this is only being used for small projects it's fantastic. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Sent used cut off saw
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a new saw, but when I opened the box (looked like it was re-taped two or three time ) the first thing I noticed was the strong smell of cement dust. On further inspection, the wires were covered in cement dust. The rubber, on the bottom of the saw stand, was worn down to the metal. To top it off they want me to pay the shipping cost to send this rebuilt piece of junk back to them.
customer_reviews.author: bosco747

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cut 2" thick patio pavers like butter. This thing is heavy and has a lot of torque when you pull the trigger so be careful and hang on!! It is cheaper to buy this than renting one for two days. Around here they rent for $75 per day and then charge you $100 for a new blade. Speaking of blades.......the $25 one that comes with this saw (can be bought separately on Amazon) is fantastic. No need for a $100 blade. If you only need the saw of a one day project just order this blade and rent the saw. I am very glad I bought this!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CabinLife

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well for cutting thick flagstone slabs.. We use a small pump sprayer to apply a small stream of water directly on the 10" blade at the cut line to knock down the dust. To keep any moisture from entering the motor we drape an absorbent towel over the grab handle to cover the motor vents, letting it breathe while reducing the the possibility of water damage to the motor. I like it, I use it, it works well..
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: very powerful machine
customer_reviews.text: I am cutting large blocks of medina sandstone and some conrete to remove them to put in a new paver walkway. some are over the cutting depth of this tool, however I am able to split these with hammer and chisel. for some reason the tool keeps tripping the 15amp circuit breaker on my generator. (it is rated at 15 amps). perhaps I am over working the tool. another issue is that the tool blade guard accumulates the debris and has to be cleaned out (wet or dry cutting). this has actually stalled the motor. however it is a very solidly built tool and I am expecting it will last to the end of my project.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Fine replacement for a gas cement saw
customer_reviews.text: I was considering a gas driven cutter, but I didn't need the larger gas driven unit. This unit is lighter, more easily set for formation cutting, easy quick cutting, and has a provided 12" concrete blade. We used this saw to cut pavers and to cut in a border brick. Additionally, we cut the uneven pavers to form an outer perimeter look. My son pushed the cut to hard on one occasion and blew a circuit breaker. Just let it cut, it will do fine.
customer_reviews.author: MikeAVacaville

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as I wish but ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw basically for one project. Need to cut about 150' length into a volcanic bedrock. In 2 days I ran it about 5-6 hours from a 4k generator using a 20A rated extension cord. It cuts pretty well with new blades on. Once the saw heats up, the blade gets hot and its operator gets tired performance is greatly reduced. Gotta give time for the blade to cool off. Also even without binding the blade and not even pushing the saw into the cut it starts choking my 4K generator and saw looses power. it may not be designed for such abusive operation. Over all if I can complete this project with it it'll pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I mean it is what it is for the price. Trips the 20amp breaker A LOT but it was also cheap and works well. It gets hot when youre run it for a while. The one thing I hate is how the handle wraps around both sides where as the Makita has a small offset on one side. Just makes it a pain when youre trying to get against a wall. Other than that I love it. I replaced all the drains in my basement as well as some projects outside and it does what I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The saw work as advertised for the first use for cutting pavers,small blocks,etc but during the second use the windings have apparently shorted and is rendered useless. I registered the product and have since left 2 emails approximately a week apart and have received nothing in return. This may be a nice saw and maybe i received a defective one but with no response from the company i highly doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: orlando s fernandes

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: If you want this as a cut off saw forget it .. it weights MORE then a gas one with 14" blade. It pops breakers because of the high amp draw all the time , but it weights way to much to be something you would think is light.. If you MUST have it let me know Ill sell you mine. it works but im warning you this thing was built obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mckee

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great price is better than renting if you have a lot of cutting to do. Removed two sunken showers and most of one bathroom floor to replace drains to septic. Also removed patio slab for additional plumbing repair and cut thru foundation slab for electrical conduit to kitchen island. Cut thru top two feet of a concrete pool around perimeter to bury pool. This thins is a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Obewan

customer_reviews.title: Rt tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a second blade from another provider based on reviews that the original blade may not cut the best, not sure that it was needed but happy that I have a second blade. Cut through seawall concrete blocks with no issue, believe the key is to not put a lot of press like the instructions say and let the saw weight do the work. I know that there was going to be some dust but I was not really ready for the cloud , make sure that you have a KN95 or better mask and note wind direction or your wife will hate this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get a contractor to my house to cut through a block wall, so I did it myself with THIS! Lots of dust but relatively easy to get used to and to maneuver. Cuts only 4" deep but was able to cut from the other side using marks made by drilling holes through the wall. No extra blades needed for my job. The blade that comes with it was enough and I'll still use the tool when I put pavers in my front walkway and side yard. I can hardly wait! Totally recommended (just beware of Amazon Packaging... mine came with severely damaged packaging)
customer_reviews.author: Chaschl

customer_reviews.title: Power draw concerns
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose however I'm concerned with power Circuit. I recall seeing it mentioned this was moved to 15A plug at some point which leads me to believe it was a 20A tool in the early stages. I used this saw with a HD econ6tractor extension cord and found the saw is pulling too much juice. So much that the plug is charred and damn near melted my extension core. Aside from the occasional cut I recommend either the manufacturer alter design to 20A cord or cut the power back. Similarly, UL testing is encouraged.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: I almost made 10 linear feet before it died
customer_reviews.text: I almost made 10 linear feet before it died to my shock after cutting 8 to 10 feet it started smoking and died to say I’m disappointed would be an understatement I am in the process of returning it I’m going to give the company one last chance by ordering another one if that one dies oh boy buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: FC Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I am currently building a garage, and in lieu of renting a concrete saw several times i purchased this Evolution 12" saw. I first used it to cut control joints in a large 6" slab. The slab is the heavier street-grade mix and this saw cut through it like butter. cut a total of 46' of concrete about 1.5-2" deep in around 15 minutes. After i use this saw a few more times it will have paid for itself in terms of unneeded tool rentals. I don't like the annoyance of maintaining small engines (especially when they are infrequently used) so i really like that this one is electric.
customer_reviews.author: Nowhere Man

customer_reviews.title: Great Blade saw 👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw for beginners or pros . It cuts through concrete and rock with ease.. I recommend it .. i do a lot of concrete jobs this is perfect light weight , you should let the blade do the cutting when you put too much pressure on it the breaker pops . But after some practice I was able to cut flawlessly..it came with a diamond blade , I love this tool ..
customer_reviews.author: Dagoe Marse

customer_reviews.title: Work's better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I've needed a professional concrete cutting saw, but couldn't stomach the high cost. This one has been on my watch list for a long time. I didn't think it could compare to the commercial versions. I received it yesterday, assembly of the blade is easy. We made 12 or more curb cuts so far with no issue. I should have bought this years ago. It does kick up a lot of dust, but there is an integral vacuum port. (haven't tried a vac on it yet) Would be nice if it had the water option for blade cooling and dust control. I'll probably try adding one at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for a home owner who doesn't want to do a rental and doesn't want to dish out $1k for a gasoline saw. It will use every bit of a 15A breaker. I've used it on pavers and natural flagstone and it cut both with zero issues. Based on amazon feedback I took off the factory blade before I used it and started with a Dewalt blade because people had issues with the stock blade life. Very happy with the saw overall.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as any other
customer_reviews.text: Had a project. Didn't want to rent one. Have other tools from the Evolution brand. From another item I know their customer service is excellent. For the price you get a lot here. It pulls a lot of power. Cuts great. Of course, with all of these, they cut as good as the blade is. So don't skimp on a good blade once you through the one which comes with it. (Which worked great on basic concrete though).
customer_reviews.author: Tinkerman

customer_reviews.title: Great value!  1/2 the price of gas powered alternatives.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to cut 77lb concrete blocks used in a mid-size residential (2-5ft high x 100ft long) retaining wall. Saw worked great after probably close to 40 deep cuts! Still on original supplied blade and it looks like its barely been used. Prefers to cut dry versus wet, but really no major issues done either way. Heavy enough to be steady and durable; however, light enough that you can maneuver around and do detail cuts. Now a neighbor/friend is borrowing for his paver project...so far he says he too loves it. Be sure to have a decent extension cord as this thing pulls some big power. Would definitely buy again as its already paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut basic brick-sized blocks for a patio retaining wall. Bought it in December, knowing I wouldn't need it until spring. Stored it in my garage. Unpacked it in May; started my job. Cut one 2"x12" block. No problem. Cut my second one, no problem. Got to my third one and the saw just stopped working. I could hear the motor running, but the blade would not turn. In the process of trying to get a replacement. I'm still under warranty, but the refund window has closed. Learn from my mistake. Avoid this one.......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't be afraid of the price.
customer_reviews.text: I work construction and didn't want to spend the $1000+ on other saws. This thing Kicked so much butt that everyone in the room had a sore butt by the end of the day and it was still going. I use it as a display now of what a real butt kicking saw can do. It just sits in the corner reminding everyone of how they got their butt kicked the day we put in a new bathroom in our building.
customer_reviews.author: Strictly Ceilings

customer_reviews.title: Great tool regardless of price
customer_reviews.text: this very economically priced tool works great. I am a homeowner/ landlord and have used my fair share of tools. Nothing but good things to say about this saw. It does have a fair amount of torque due to the blade spin and takes a little practice to start your cut. Once you master this the saw cuts very well. I made a few hundred cuts on 60mm pavers with little wear showing on the blade at the end of the project. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: Not for contractors, this cutter can't handle big jobs. Unless we were sent a factory fluke.
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working on day 2 on a 16 hour job cutting pavers for driveway and service walks. It did appear to have some abrasions and some concrete dust on it in places when it came out of the box so it's possible someone used it and it was refurbished or reconditioned. Not sure but it stopped altogether when cutting service walk pavers.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: This saw got me through a tough project
customer_reviews.text: I bought this needing to remove a 4 x 6 ft cement slab that was 10 to 12 inches thick. I tried various other methods, none of which worked but this saw combined with a sledge hammer worked great. The saw did everything I hoped it would and it did it well. I'm pleased with its performance. The seller also got me the product in good time which was also very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cut Concrete Like Butter
customer_reviews.text: Made a total of 25ft of 4" cuts on concrete. . .no problems whatsoever. It made smooth "polished" cuts on the concrete sides where I cut. Set up took like 5 minutes and I was ready to go. Like other reviews commented- the darn thing is extremely powerful and you will need a > 20A circuit or your going to be frustrated running over to the breaker box when you hit rebar (or at startup) Worth every penny as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Rocket Mann

customer_reviews.title: What a beast! Great asphalt cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cutter to install a channel drain in asphalt. When I first pulled the trigger, I knew I had a beast of a tool. It cut right through the 4" asphalt without any trouble. The only issue was my learning curve on how to hold it for a straight cut. After a couple of minutes, that was not a problem. It does get heavy, so take your time. It goes without saying, it makes a lot of dust!!! No, really, a lot of dust... Wear a dust mask.
customer_reviews.author: Macjville

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Evolution product. I also have the metal cutting chop saw and metal cutting Skill saw. The companies commitment to quality is unmatched. The concrete saw performed amazing. At a quarter the price and weight of its gas powered equivalent, it’s a win from anyway you look at it. I would recommend this product for both home or industrial use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Thomas Photography

customer_reviews.title: Saw is great for cutting pavers & block!
customer_reviews.text: Saw is great for cutting pavers & block! I've been using a Skil worm drive saw with a masonry blade for years. Having to be on my knees all day cutting is no fun. Wit this saw I can stand and be away from the dust. This saw takes some getting used to just like any tool, but once i got used to it I can control it and it cuts great slow and steady. I'm sure if I bought an expensive diamond blade it would cut faster. The best way I've found to cut is scribe your mark line and then go back and forth over the line
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Light weight saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw literally fell apart after a week of use! I would not purchase this product!
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Olds

customer_reviews.title: This saw is awesome. Great addition to the toolshed.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cut a curved walkway. Made it through both sides of the 40' walkway using the blade it came with. I would have spent at least this much on a rental, and ended up using a much heavier gas saw. With no water expect a lot of silica dust. Get a good mask and goggles.
customer_reviews.author: rLogix

customer_reviews.title: a little under powerd
customer_reviews.text: First time used I noticed a cracked case, doesn't seem to have a lot of power for the weight of it, I bought it for cutting steel. I put 1/8" Dewalt metal cutting disc on it and it had trouble cutting 1/8" steel sheet and angle. I'll try a thinner disc but the motor just doesn't seem to have much power. For 200 bucks it dose work with but with a ginger touch.
customer_reviews.author: sparky c

customer_reviews.title: Problem
customer_reviews.text: This saw only last 4 weeks under Regular construction Work Supplier refused to replace the tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this disc cutter a few days ago.It came well packed but after laying out found that it was missing a washer that holds the disk on.Contacted Evolution support and they immediately shipped me a new one.Very polite and efficient customer service. Tried a test cut on concrete and seeems to cut nicely.The unit is well built and should give me good cutting for many years. It is priced at a little over two hundreds dollars which is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: LJ Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a flip house I'm working on to cut 4" concrete slab to install a trench drain. The power supply was a 7000w generator and it did the job in short order. The only glitch was with me buy not using a large enough gauge extension cord. Tripped the generator breaker. The blade that came with it was really good quality, well good enough to cut 24' of 4" old concrete. But this saw you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R

customer_reviews.title: Big saw, great value.
customer_reviews.text: I used this saw to help hollow out a limestone sink I was making. It handled the job just fine, making relief cuts into an 8 inch deep slab of limestone, which is similar to cement. It’s heavy to wield, but I found that helped with the cuts.
customer_reviews.author: CNG

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: The blade that comes with the saw has a 1" arbor but the manual indicates that the blade plates (supplied) require a blade with either a 7/8" or a 3/4" arbor. Apparently the adapter is supposed to come with the blade but it was missing from my package. So now I have to either find a store that sells this adapter (no luck so far) or buy a whole new blade that has the right arbor diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: No gas, no broken pull cords, no fuss, just plug in, hit the switch, and go
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little saw, and while the blade size may leave something to be desired in terms of total depth of cut, it makes up for it in just the ease of use. No broken pull cords, no trying to get the saw fired up for 20 minutes, no gas, no issues. Even on a landscape crew, this saw is worth it's weight in gold as a back up to a larger main saw. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: USPS refuse to deliver, saying it was to heavy and had to be pick up at the post office.
customer_reviews.text: USPS refuse to deliver saying it was too heavy, had to pick up at the post office. Prime Membership is now off a lesser value, it didn't do anything for me in this purchase. The Saw was in its original manufacture box no addition packaging, bobble rap or cushioning was provided. The box was damage, but the saw is working well.
customer_reviews.author: anann

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SAW- BETTER THAN MAKITA
customer_reviews.text: We did the basement project. Awesome saw! Better than Makita rental from Home Depot!! Cut a thin line first, wet the area with some water, so it sits in the grove - it makes the cutting a lot easier and quicker! Tip: use electric leaf blower and some flexible vent pipe to remove the dust if you cutting inside. just connect the the flex pipe with the leaf blower outlet and stick it outside the window and the leaf blower will work as vent/ vaccum - works great!
customer_reviews.author: ania

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT inexpensive saw! I know it's made over seas, but I don't use one of these enough to warrant buying a good Stihl gas job ( Plus, I didn't want the hassle of gas going bad in the small engine) I have used it to cut stone primarily, some granite, some flat patio stone. It cut through both of them like BUTTAH! I did make a lot of cuts before the blade started to get dull, but if you have a large job, you may want to order an extra blade to have on hand. All in all I'm happy with the purchase and would buy another if need be.
customer_reviews.author: mattywho

customer_reviews.title: I bought another one, after the first one died
customer_reviews.text: The first one died, after cutting about 500 linear feet of concrete, mostly 4" thick. I don't use it very often, so that took 5 years. The brushes still had about 5/8" remaining, and the motor was not seized, so I think the winding just overheated and burned out. Works well. I can use it indoors, with minimal ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfull Saw with multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to work on a remodel project of an old concrete block house. I also have a business installing paver patios, retaining walls, etc. I first used it to cut concrete retaining wall blocks and was very pleased with the ease of cutting. Then I replaced the diamond concrete blade with a 12" wood cutting blade and used the saw to demolish an old shed. Worked so good that I don't know how I could have done it with out this saw. Next, we'll start on the concrete house demo. Looking forward to it as I now know this saw is tough enough yet easy to handle for just about anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Griggs

customer_reviews.title: Great product, 2 things I would change.
customer_reviews.text: I have used variations of this saw many times. From gas powered to very expensive electric ones. This thing is awesome. Only 2 down sides I can think of. No water hook-up, more expensive brands do offer this even in an electric platform. And the handle over the blade is bulky. It pushes you out probably 4"-6" away from an object. Makes it hard if you need to cut along a wall or another object. Overall would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K. S.

customer_reviews.title: I was already nervous and seeing parts falling out while using a tool that could easily kill me if I made a mistake didn't make
customer_reviews.text: This thing's a BEAST!! I've never done any concrete work so I was nervous to use this, but it was MUCH easier to use than I feared. My ONLY complaint is one of the handle screws fell out after about 2 mins of use. I was already nervous and seeing parts falling out while using a tool that could easily kill me if I made a mistake didn't make me feel too comfortable. However, I replaced the bolt, checked all others (none of the rest were loose), and went back to work. This thing did a great job at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: R Porter

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: We don’t do a lot of concrete cutting but enough to justify having the tool taking up space in the shop rather than treks to the rental yard. This light but powerful [never slowed it down yet] saw avoids the lurch of full throttle starts and is easy enough to maneuver for very accurate cuts.
customer_reviews.author: FolkKey

customer_reviews.title: good electric concrete saw
customer_reviews.text: I like this saw, works great, in others reviews some recommended buying a better saw blade so I did, I have not put it on yet because the blade that comes with it has been working great. If you have to do any vertical cutting you will like the weight of this saw compared to the gas ones. Highly recommend for the weekend warrior.
customer_reviews.author: Don Keister

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was installing a car lift system in the winter and the barn is enclosed, so this is the perfect way to work around the CO fumes. I used water lightly on the floor to control the silica and the saw easily cut through the concrete. while the cut depth is typically around 4". it was enough. Good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry , Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Must have at home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hubby, he was on an on complaining about water backing up on the driveway really annoying him. In literally few minutes cut off the concrete, fixed whatever the problem was and moved on. The end of that same week, my daughter had a water breakage underneath her driveway. My husband took care of it without much extra effort. He was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grammy

customer_reviews.title: very good for money
customer_reviews.text: very good for money , you have to use water ,and move very slow and steady cut 3-3/4 deep i did 150' in the basement for french drain ,it took me 3.5 hours i was cutting 3-3/4'' thick , i used 20A breaker works better 15A good for somthing small
customer_reviews.author: vadim

customer_reviews.title: for the price is great
customer_reviews.text: no issues, love it I treat it with respect and I don't abuse it I am a DYI and i have completed all the projects I tasked this summer. a lot of dust but wear a mask (the same blade that came with the unit, next year i will have it replace it just to make it easier for the unit to maintain. i will add photos later on
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ventura.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, great price.
customer_reviews.text: We had 12 holes to cut in a ceiling that was 4 inch thick concrete with heavy wire re-enforcement. Each hole was 16" X 16". My helper used a squirt bottle with water to lube the blade and keep the dust down. The saw preformed great without a hiccup. To top it off we only used the blade that was provided with the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Turner

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't bog down or get hot easily, even without water
customer_reviews.text: I have a pool company and was looking for an alternative way to cut stone and slab without water and the weight of the gas powered saws. Granted, you would not want to take out a large concrete deck with this saw, but for trimming pavers, stone, walkways, and general hardscape work, it is the real deal!! It makes quick work of faux stone work patterns on concrete. It doesn't bog down or get hot easily, even without water. The dust is thick, so wear a mask, but it is better than the glue like sludge produced by the wet method. It is a stonemason's dream at an incredible price. I will probably get a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Redman51

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Power Tool
customer_reviews.text: This saw is something special. I used it extensively when I was building some curvy, multi-level retaining walls at my house and for some control joints in concrete flatwork. I found this saw to be a viable alternative to using a gas powered saw for those purposes. It's not as powerful as a gas powered saw, of course, but it is lighter, less maintenance intensive and more cost effective. The build quality is excellent. With proper care (keep the motor vents clean), I expect it to last a long time. It would be nice if it came with a case.
customer_reviews.author: Nivek

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for me home owner use.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the money. Just cut 35ft of 3 inch pavement for a drain and it worked great. A few other rocks and concrete in the way also cut. Lots of dust so wear a mask and eye protection. Only issue and thus mark down one star from perfect is that the Allen bolts that hold the handle on rattled out., put some blue threadlocker on, tighten and all good.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how well it worked
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used/refurbished saw. I didn't really know what to expect but used it this weekend and it was very effective. I was concerned that since it was electric it may not have enough torque to get through some of the thick concrete I had to cut but it had no problem. Since it is electric you can't run water over the work surface so I used a fan to blow the dust off so I could see the area I was cutting, otherwise you will be cutting blind. I recommend this tool, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Did a 15'x15' paver area with a 5'x5' fire-pit in the center. Every edge needed cut due to the design of the 2" thick stone. This thing did all of it without any issue. I did switch out blades about 1/2 way through the project but I don't know that I needed too, I just felt it taking a little more time to cut through this stuff and didn't have extra stone to mess the project up.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this saw is a great value. It cuts well but definitely faster wet cutting. It’s best to use water anyway as silica is hazardous to breathe. Also make sure to use this saw with nothing else running on same circuit breaker as it has a consistently high draw. Not a complaint by any means, I’m extremely happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of equipment, cheaper than renting.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to cut concrete block and to grove a concrete pad. The saw works well and is a solid piece of equipment. It has plenty of torque and is fast cutting. The saw is heavy enough without a lot of down pressure needed to do the job. I had no trouble using it with a 15 amp circuit breaker. I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Arther Picknose

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in one job!
customer_reviews.text: The fact this saw can pay for itself in one job sold me. The fact it has a warranty extended made it even better. I have a money making saw now for the next 4 years till this warranty is up. I would buy this again ten times over if need be. You can't beat the quality for the money. As a plumber I saw concrete all the time. This saw is grade A quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw! Works with 110v outlet. Good for cutting 4” residential slab. Not overly heavy. It doesn’t have a way to wet cut, likely because it’s electric but I have been successful at placing a hose near the cutting area and thus mitigating silica/concrete dust exposure.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Electric 12" Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut some ledge and stone in my yard. Hard job but this demo saw did a great job. Only tripped the breaker once. Trick is to let the tool do its job and not apply a ton of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Techkie

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saw. It has made the project that I’m working on so much easier. I wish I would’ve got it a lot sooner. I’m cutting retaining wall blocks with this saw. The blade that came with it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C3

customer_reviews.title: Good for DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. I used it to remove a concrete floor. Blade started to dull after an hour. Used shop vac but still dusty. Tripped 15 amp breaker a few times but allowed me a break. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: The House

customer_reviews.title: the squeeze trigger switch didnt last long on mine. ...
customer_reviews.text: the squeeze trigger switch didnt last long on mine. now i have to set the saw on the ground and magically push the button to the side with one hand and squeezing trigger with the other... what a pain..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it. Much better price than a gas version
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Much better price than a gas version. Cuts dry so be prepared for some dust. A good respirator is a MUST even when working outside. The original blade is lasting quite a long time. Good for the DIY job or as a contractor's backup saw.
customer_reviews.author: jutty

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for cutting basement flooring. Did spray with hose to keep dust down but with the rear guard in the rotated down position so it contacts the concrete, the motor doesn't get wet at all. Might want to have more then a 20 amp circuit because it will trip the breaker once in a while when starting and while cutting. And yes, I was using a heavy extension cord and the circuit was wired correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: short lived
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a short period of time then failed. Took it in to service and they cleaned the concrete dust and replaced bushings. Lasted another week. Doesn't cut deep enough to get through a concrete floor but did well on other applications
customer_reviews.author: DK Million

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: This saw works well, easy to use, probably as much power as you would want a hand held saw to have. Requires a heavy cord and a 20 amp power supply. I cut four inches of wire reinforced concrete with it. Maybe 60 feet of cutting.
customer_reviews.author: HBE

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the Evolution DISCCUT1 12 inch disc cutter with ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Evolution DISCCUT1 12 inch disc cutter with the diamond blade to cut my 4" driveway for conduit installation. The saw was much easier to use than circular saw, and I was able to
customer_reviews.author: William J Fawbush

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Was very leary about this saw because of the low price, but I was very pleased with it's performance. Cut for an entire day on cap stones and pavers up to 3 inches thick with no issues. Lots of dust though, I used a fan to blow it away while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Imbasman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I needed to cut the corner off a concrete slab. I was tired of paying $100 to rent a cut-off saw and blade. I operate a company that builds docks and boathouses. I rent/borrow a concrete saw a dozen times a year. This unit broke within the first 4 minutes. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: I'm a kitchen and bathroom contractor. every once in a while I need a concrete saw to move some pipes underground so I don't use the saw on a daily basis. I have used this saw a few times and it got the job done. the reason I took a star off is, it does trip the breaker quite a few times during use. other wise works great. no issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible choice
customer_reviews.text: The motor on this concrete saw burnt out after cutting 30 feet of concrete. I want a refund!
customer_reviews.author: R. D.

customer_reviews.title: This saw is comparable to more expensive saws.
customer_reviews.text: My husband used this masonry saw to cut solid retaining wall cap that was 3 1/2” thick. He used a 50’ heavy duty cord and didn’t trip the breaker. This saw has a lot of power and didn’t bog down Take your time cutting and it’ll do the job. Great saw for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mary a baker

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Evolution product I bought. Lesson learned, it’s junk, Harbor Freight quality
customer_reviews.author: Eric Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Cuts concrete like butter
customer_reviews.text: I was able to excavate an old bathroom sewer and cut all new channels for the new bathroom with this saw. It cut right through the slab so all i had to do after cutting was lift the channel out and I was in business. Worth the $200 and does the job just as well as my buddy's $800 makita.
customer_reviews.author: Shmeg McGee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Small Flag 5’ x 8’ stone patio under my grill. Perfect for the price point. Did everything I needed plus more. First time cutting flagstone - wow it creates a lot of dust!
customer_reviews.author: Del Bullion

customer_reviews.title: Exellent Cutting For The Money
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Comparable to small gas powered concrete saw. Heavy, but it is a concrete/masonry saw. I think a great value. Cut my 18' wide driveway, 3" deep in about an hour. DID NOT NEED 20AMP TO 15AMP CORD/PLUG ADAPTER (mine came with U.S. conventional plug).
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing concrete saw!
customer_reviews.text: I just cut out my broken sidewalk in back of our house. This part of our sidewalk is 7feet 6inches long and 3" thick with no rebar. This saw cut through it very easy. Be sure to just let the saw do the cutting and don't force it. Make sure you have the proper amp beaker for the saw and also your extension cord or you will probably trip your breaker! Be sure to wear hearing protection and also a good dust mask. You can also use a cordless leaf blower to blow the dust away from you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Good saw for the price,
customer_reviews.text: got to use it today and it surpassed my expectations, in 15 mins I payed for the saw, I cut out a number of old foundation stem walls, about 2 foot tall, and 8 inches thick, cut one side and then the other, I had to make sure the extension cord was 12 gauge and the saw was the only thing on the 20 amp breaker,
customer_reviews.author: B D

customer_reviews.title: Get One, don't rent one
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was 14 inches but it did the trick! For basically the cost of a weekend rental with a blade along with it, it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MESR

customer_reviews.title: Need 20 amp circuit with GFCI as noted in other reviews
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best buy out there for the money. High torque, above average quality, blade is durable, and no need to fill the gas tank and keep restarting the engine. Gets the job done for almost the same price as renting for a week! Cutting straight cuts from two sides with a high torque, heavy tool like this takes practice and a little muscle and a bit of talent. Understanding the materials you are cutting and safety is often overlooked. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bose Guy

customer_reviews.title: Blaze Orange Lemon
customer_reviews.text: A blaze orange lemon- ended up returning product- constantly overheated and tripped breaker within seconds right out of the box despite running on dedicated circuit. Have had many power tools over the years and something clearly wrong in this instance - most likely shoddy motor or construction. Had to rent a saw to finish the job which worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend it as your wife's anniversary gift, but it works well for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: The saw worked well, but generates a lot of dust. A lot of dust gets pulled into the motor, which is not good. I use a fan to blow the dust away when sawing, which should extend tool life.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Sea

customer_reviews.title: No Longevity
customer_reviews.text: I am not hard on tools. The gears in the unit stripped and it quit several days after I received it to cut some openings in tile brick in an old building. I liked the tool as it was electric, and suited my purposes well. Just quit to soon
customer_reviews.author: Steve Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Very happy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a few times in the last year but I am very impressed for the money... We cut sections of concrete around pools for repairs....would highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good product, better price
customer_reviews.text: The saw has very good cutting power and ability and a great price point. Developing one of these with a water system at a great price point I think would be a home run for evolution.
customer_reviews.author: GREGORY L.

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great saw for the money. It cuts through the cement as it should. A few reasons for the 4 star rating is the blade it comes with is on the cheaper side. After installing the new blade it worked like a charm. The dust containment tube does not do much. I would suggest adding a bit longer tube to kick the dust away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice clean cuts
customer_reviews.text: Do it yourself paver patio project. Thought at first I could do this with my skill saw. Well that idea did not last very long. Considered renting a concrete saw, but then found this and the price was right. Do not let the price influence you; this is a well-built saw that handled the pavers cuts very well. Nice clean cuts, lots of dust but that was expected. Paver patio was 800 square feet and the cuts on the edges look professional. Strongly recommend this saw for your paver patio project.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Workman

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: For "homeowner" use this is perfect. I easily cut through concrete block with rebar for a wall opening in the side of my house. Just plunge from both sides and your all the way through. Compared to the other options, you can either spend $1000 on a ryobi, or rent for $70/hr PLUS blade cost! This is a no brainer purchase. The blade alone cost $80 or more.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lane

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: I used the saw and it worked great. It cut through the cement like butter. I use it for 20 minutes and let it rest 30 minutes to cool the electric motor.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: What a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Opened 4" concrete slab for adding bathroom plumbing. What an impressive saw for the money. It ran fantastic. If it never cut another inch ive got my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Oddy

customer_reviews.title: Great Find!
customer_reviews.text: As long as you have a good power source this thing is awesome. It doesn’t cut quite as quick as a gas-powered(obviously) but for the price and being virtually maintainace free, it’s so worth it. I’m a hardscape contractor and I am extremely satisfied with this saw
customer_reviews.author: GNC

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Saw.... Better than most
customer_reviews.text: This saw cut so we'll...you can purchase this saw for just 2 rentals fees....buy it and you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cole

customer_reviews.title: This is a great saw. Balanced
customer_reviews.text: I've been a mason for over 20 years. This is a great saw. Balanced. Decent power. No fumes like the gas saws. Even the blade it comes with is well above par. I even added water to mine, it works great. Make sure it is the only thing on the circuit though otherwise it does pull enough juice to trip, repeatedly. It's lasted more than one job so, especially for the price, it's already paid for itself, a couple of times over. Overall, would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: dawn clark

customer_reviews.title: Great for Retaining Wall
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a retaining wall project that lasted a couple days. Cut through the 2” wall caps and 4” retaining wall blocks easily with plenty of power. I didn’t have a shop vac, but I recommend using it if your doing this type of work. I used a mask but it would have been better with all the dust this kicks up. Definitely would recommend buying this saw and the blade that comes with it is fine. No problem there for the amount of work I was doing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Becker

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw for cutting large rocks, located directly behind my home in Ten. This saw worked like a champ. I was very impressed with it's cutting power and torque, and for a third the price.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

product_meta.title: Evolution DISCCUT1 12" Disc Cutter, Orange
product_meta.description: Evolution's electric disc Cutter easily cuts concrete, Stone, brick, and paving, even reinforced concrete, With the supplied 12" Diamond blade. The powerful 15amp/ 1800W motor makes easy work of the most robust materials and because it is electric there are no harmful fumes, making it ideal for work in enclosed areas. The ergonomic support handles are ideally positioned for perfect balance when cutting and the spindle lock mechanism means blade replacement is quick and simple. The ideal alternative to high maintenance, gasoline-powered disc cutters
feature_bullets: Robust & versatile the Evolution electric disc cutter easily cuts concrete even tough reinforced concrete, stone, brick, paving and other materials.
Safe & economical, the 15Amp (1800W) hi-torque, electric motor means no harmful fumes. Alternative to high maintenance, petrol-powered disc cutters!
The ergonomic soft-grip, mid-position, front and rear support handles are positioned -to aid accurate cutting in both horizontal and vertical modes.
Supplied with a 12" diamond blade, the disc cutter can achieve a large 4" max. cutting depth through progressive / incremental cutting.
The safety guard is fully adjustable. The spindle lock mechanism allows simple blade replacement.
Easy to use and maintenance free
This demolition saw is sometimes used as an alternative to a plate compactor, demotion hammer, or jackhammer.
Easy to use and maintenance free
This demolition saw is sometimes used as an alternative to a plate compactor, demotion hammer, or jackhammer.
